name: Harvester Druid
text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land you control could produce.

editions.flavor: "In the end, the same soil lies atop the field, within the mountain, and under the sea."

name: Harvester of Souls
text:
Deathtouch
Whenever another nontoken creature dies, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"He is judge, jury, and executioner because he killed them all."
—Bishop Cawle of Elgaud

"He is judge, jury, and executioner because he killed them all."
—Bishop Cawle of Elgaud

"He is judge, jury, and executioner because he killed them all."
—Bishop Cawle of Elgaud

name: Harvester Troll
text: When Harvester Troll enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature or land. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Harvester Troll.

editions.flavor: Having no interest in the greater conflict, the trolls continue to prey upon whatever wanders into their domain.

name: Harvestguard Alseids
text: Constellation — Whenever Harvestguard Alseids or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

editions.flavor: Not all shields are forged of iron or bronze.

name: Harvest Gwyllion
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

editions.flavor: She speaks only in vile epithets, spitting out curses and obscenities that harm others just by the hearing.

name: Harvest Hand
text: When Harvest Hand dies, return it to the battlefield transformed under your control.

editions.flavor: The harvest is never finished.

name: Harvest Mage
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Until end of turn, if you tap a land for mana, it produces one mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type and amount.

editions.flavor: "Why should one limit oneself to the resources at hand?"

name: Harvest Pyre
text:
As an additional cost to cast Harvest Pyre, exile X cards from your graveyard.
Harvest Pyre deals X damage to target creature.

editions.flavor: Corpses destroyed by fire form the most destructive geists.

name: Harvest Wurm
text: When Harvest Wurm enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return a basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
The wurm's weave
—Elvish expression meaning
"plowed fields"

name: Hasran Ogress
text: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.

name: Hatchet Bully
text: {2}{R}, {T}, Put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control: Hatchet Bully deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: "It's not much for eating, but I think we can find somethin' to do with it."

name: Hatching Plans
text: When Hatching Plans is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw three cards.

editions.flavor: So wondrous to behold, so delicate and finely crafted—and yet, such a pleasure to smash.

name: Hateflayer
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{2}{R}, {Q}: Hateflayer deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: It has no safe side.

name: Hate Weaver
text: {2}: Target blue or red creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Let my hate fuel your fury."
"Let my hate fuel your fury."

name: Hatred
text:
As an additional cost to cast Hatred, pay X life.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I will flay the skin from your flesh and the flesh from your bones and scrape your bones dry. And still you will not have suffered enough."
—Greven il-Vec, to Gerrard

name: Haunted Angel
text:
Flying
When Haunted Angel dies, exile Haunted Angel and each other player creates a 3/3 black Angel creature token with flying.

name: Haunted Cadaver
text:
Whenever Haunted Cadaver deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, that player discards three cards.
Morph {1}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Haunted Cloak
text:
Equipped creature has vigilance, trample, and haste.
Equip {1}

editions.flavor: Bear the weight of so many spirits and you'll surrender civility and restraint to savagery and instinct.

name: Haunted Crossroads
text: {B}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.

editions.flavor: It seemed as if no one wanted them to reach the Henge of Ramos—not even the dead.

name: Haunted Dead
text:
When Haunted Dead enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
{1}{B}, Discard two cards: Return Haunted Dead from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

name: Haunted Fengraf
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Haunted Fengraf: Return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: A ghoulcaller's playground.
A ghoulcaller's playground.

name: Haunted Guardian
text: Defender, first strike

editions.flavor:
"Drain the victim's blood, sell the corpse, and use the soul on guard duty. No muss, no fuss, no problems."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Haunted Plate Mail
text:
Equipped creature gets +4/+4.
{0}: Until end of turn, Haunted Plate Mail becomes a 4/4 Spirit artifact creature that's no longer an Equipment. Activate this ability only if you control no creatures.
Equip {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Haunter of Nightveil
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-0.

editions.flavor: The Dimir employ the spirits of Ravnica's ancient, nameless dead, guiding their malevolence toward selected victims.

name: Haunting Apparition
text:
Flying
As Haunting Apparition enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Haunting Apparition's power is equal to 1 plus the number of green creature cards in the chosen player's graveyard.

editions.flavor: Like some foul herdbeast, it grazes on the dead.

name: Haunting Echoes
text: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard other than basic land cards. For each card exiled this way, search that player's library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Haunting Hymn
text: Target player discards two cards. If you cast this spell during your main phase, that player discards four cards instead.

editions.flavor: The hymn's melody has persisted since Tourach's time, but the words changed to invoke the phobias of each listener.

name: Haunting Misery
text:
As an additional cost to cast Haunting Misery, exile X creature cards from your graveyard.
Haunting Misery deals X damage to target player.

editions.flavor:
"I am condemned without end."
—Crovax

name: Haunting Wind
text: Whenever an artifact becomes tapped or a player activates an artifact's ability without {T} in its activation cost, Haunting Wind deals 1 damage to that artifact's controller.

editions.flavor: These devices lured so many spirits that sometimes entire battlefields would become haunted at once.

name: Havengul Lich
text: {1}: You may cast target creature card in a graveyard this turn. When you cast that card this turn, Havengul Lich gains all activated abilities of that card until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Fusing intelligence with the power of undeath requires inspiration of the darkest kind.

name: Havengul Runebinder
text: {2}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token, then put a +1/+1 counter on each Zombie creature you control.

editions.flavor: "So many corpses, so little time."
"So many corpses, so little time."

name: Havengul Skaab
text: Whenever Havengul Skaab attacks, return another creature you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: An abomination so violent that the other fiends tremble at the sight of it.

name: Havengul Vampire
text:
Whenever Havengul Vampire deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Havengul Vampire.

editions.flavor: "That slowly decreasing pulse—that's the beat I waltz to."

name: Haven of the Spirit Dragon
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a Dragon creature spell.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Haven of the Spirit Dragon: Return target Dragon creature card or Ugin planeswalker card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Havenwood Battleground
text:
Havenwood Battleground enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Havenwood Battleground: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

name: Havenwood Wurm
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Trample

editions.flavor: Time rifts bring tunneling beasts of old into the hard, dry earth of the present. Most die there, trapped, but the mightiest burst through the surface.

name: Havoc
text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, he or she loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: As Orim put the lightning rod into place on the bow, she cast a spell of protection to shield herself from the heat. That's when the Furnace got personal.

name: Havoc Demon
text:
Flying
When Havoc Demon dies, all creatures get -5/-5 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A cry of pain as it enters this world. A chorus of screams as it leaves.
A cry of pain as it enters this world. A chorus of screams as it leaves.

name: Havoc Festival
text:
Players can't gain life.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses half his or her life, rounded up.

editions.flavor:
"We can't control enemies who have no regard for their own survival."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Havoc Sower
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{1}{C}: Havoc Sower gets +2/+1 until end of turn. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

editions.flavor: It grew with a terrible swiftness.

name: Hawkeater Moth
text:
Flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Each day at dusk the birds above the canopy grow silent.

name: Hazardous Conditions
text: Creatures with no counters on them get -2/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "There are many reasons we invent, of which survival is not the least."

name: Hazduhr the Abbot
text: {X}, {T}: The next X damage that would be dealt this turn to target white creature you control is dealt to Hazduhr the Abbot instead.

editions.flavor:
"Soon, Serra will return and choose the Abbot's successor, else we are lost."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Haze Frog
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Haze Frog enters the battlefield, prevent all combat damage that other creatures would deal this turn.

editions.flavor: Its breath leaves its prey too drowsy to struggle.

name: Haze of Rage
text:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

name: Hazerider Drake
text: Flying, protection from red

editions.flavor:
"The hazerider danced in the thunderstorm and sang to its music."
—Afari, Tales

name: Hazezon Tamar
text:
When Hazezon Tamar enters the battlefield, create X 1/1 Sand Warrior creature tokens that are red, green, and white at the beginning of your next upkeep, where X is the number of lands you control at that time.
When Hazezon leaves the battlefield, exile all Sand Warriors.

name: Hazy Homunculus
text: Hazy Homunculus can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an untapped land.

editions.flavor: They hide in dreams and whispers and faraway thoughts.

name: Head Games
text: Target opponent puts the cards from his or her hand on top of his or her library. Search that player's library for that many cards. The player puts those cards into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

name: Headhunter
text:
Whenever Headhunter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Morph {B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: ". . . The ghost rides forth to the scene of battle in nightly quest of his head . . . he sometimes passes along the Hollow, like a midnight blast . . ." —Washington Irving, The Legend of Sleepy Hollow

name: Headless Skaab
text:
As an additional cost to cast Headless Skaab, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Headless Skaab enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: A head is a needless encumbrance when muscle is all that's required.

name: Headlong Rush
text: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A landslide of goblins poured toward the defenders—tumbling, rolling, and bouncing their way down the steep hillside.

name: Headstone
text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"Your headstone is the last page in the book of your life."
—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Head to Head
text: You and target opponent play Seven Questions about the top card of that player's library. (That player looks at the card, then you ask up to six yes-or-no questions about the card that he or she answers truthfully. You guess the card's name—that's question seven—and the player reveals the card.) If you win, prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn by a source of your choice.

name: Heal
text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Healer of the Pride
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: "No life is without meaning. No living thing is too small to be strong."

name: Healer's Headdress
text:
Equipped creature gets +0/+2 and has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn."
{W}{W}: Attach Healer's Headdress to target creature you control.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Healing Hands
text:
Target player gains 4 life.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: The ethereal touch brings relief. The physical touch brings peace.

name: Healing Leaves
text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: The elves of Llanowar don't trust in alchemy. They rely instead on pure herbs harvested from the forest's sacred heart.

name: Healing Salve
text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic

editions.flavor:
"The Femeref look only to the Sun for healing; they have never truly understood life's cycle."
—Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage

"Xantcha is recovering. The medicine is slow, but my magic would have killed her."
—Serra, to Urza

name: Heal the Scars
text: Regenerate target creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: Elvish battle-magic has evolved two specialties: inflicting wounds that scar, and healing wounds without scarring. Politics determines the recipients of each.

name: Heap Doll
text: Sacrifice Heap Doll: Exile target card from a graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"I know one night it won't come back. Then I'll know it's truly done its job."
—Braenna, cobblesmith

name: Heartbeat of Spring
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

editions.flavor:
"It is true that we monks hold the key to paradise, but most don't understand that the paradise we guard is the one within."
—Diary of Azusa

name: Hearthcage Giant
text:
When Hearthcage Giant enters the battlefield, create two 3/1 red Elemental Shaman creature tokens.
Sacrifice an Elemental: Target Giant creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The flamekin are mere kindling for his warmth.

name: Hearth Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact creature.
• Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

name: Hearthfire Hobgoblin
text: Double strike

editions.flavor: Hobgoblins are best left alone. They sharpen their farm implements far more than is necessary for their work in the fields.
Hobgoblins are best left alone. They sharpen their farm implements far more than is necessary for their work in the fields.
Hobgoblins are best left alone. They sharpen their farm implements far more than is necessary for their work in the fields.

name: Hearth Kami
text: {X}, Sacrifice Hearth Kami: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X.

editions.flavor:
"Every treachery, great or small, begets a spirit that rages at the injustice. Given the opportunity, each will return that treachery to its owner tenfold."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Heartlash Cinder
text:
Haste
Chroma — When Heartlash Cinder enters the battlefield, it gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of red mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.

name: Heartless Hidetsugu
text: {T}: Heartless Hidetsugu deals damage to each player equal to half that player's life total, rounded down.

editions.flavor: Hidetsugu held over a dozen oni in blood oath. At his touch, rocks scorched. At his word, cities burned.
Hidetsugu held over a dozen oni in blood oath. At his touch, rocks scorched. At his word, cities burned.

name: Heartless Summoning
text:
Creature spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
Creatures you control get -1/-1.

editions.flavor:
"They won't be winning any beauty pageants, but they'll do the trick."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Heartmender
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a -1/-1 counter from each creature you control.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Heart of Bogardan
text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When a player doesn't pay Heart of Bogardan's cumulative upkeep, Heart of Bogardan deals X damage to target player and each creature he or she controls, where X is twice the number of age counters on Heart of Bogardan minus 2.

name: Heart of Kiran
text:
Flying, vigilance
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)
You may remove a loyalty counter from a planeswalker you control rather than pay Heart of Kiran's crew cost.

name: Heart of Light
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
"There is a shining in the mortal heart that even the kami cannot reach."
—Sensei Golden-Tail
For those who reach enlightenment, violence is an unnecessary distraction.

name: Heart of Ramos
text:
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Heart of Ramos: Add {R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Ramos bled, and there was fire.

name: Heart of Yavimaya
text:
If Heart of Yavimaya would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Forest instead. If you do, put Heart of Yavimaya onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Heart-Piercer Bow
text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, Heart-Piercer Bow deals 1 damage to target creature defending player controls.
Equip {1}

editions.flavor: Designed by an ancient artificer, the finest Mardu bows are carved from dragon bone and strung with the wind itself.

name: Heartseeker
text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+1 and has "{T}, Unattach Heartseeker: Destroy target creature."
Equip {5} ({5}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

name: Heart Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have haste.

editions.flavor: Gerrard looked all around for the source of the mysterious pulse, and at that moment the slivers boiled forth from the crevasses.
Gerrard looked all around for the source of the mysterious pulse, and at that moment the slivers boiled forth from the crevasses.

name: Heartstabber Mosquito
text:
Kicker {2}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Heartstabber Mosquito enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target creature.

name: Heartstone
text: Activated abilities of creatures cost {1} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the amount of mana an ability costs to activate to less than one mana.

editions.flavor:
"Finding a true heartstone is even harder than finding a true heart."
—Hanna

"Finding a true heartstone is even harder than finding a true heart."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Heart Warden
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{2}, Sacrifice Heart Warden: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"In Llanowar, we tend the forest's boughs and branches. In Yavimaya, we are a part of them."
—Rofellos of Llanowar

name: Heart Wolf
text:
First strike
{T}: Target Dwarf creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Heart Wolf. Activate this ability only during combat.

name: Heartwood Dryad
text: Heartwood Dryad can block creatures with shadow as though Heartwood Dryad had shadow.

editions.flavor: To snare what lies between worlds takes the patient reach of trees.
To snare what lies between worlds takes the patient reach of trees.

name: Heartwood Giant
text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Heartwood Giant deals 2 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Wind in the trees is soothing, but the same can't be said for trees on the wind.
Wind in the trees is soothing, but the same can't be said for trees on the wind.

name: Heartwood Shard
text: {3}, {T} or {G}, {T}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Like all other relics, it was left on the Radix by the elves to be destroyed. Unlike all other relics, it persisted.

name: Heartwood Storyteller
text: Whenever a player casts a noncreature spell, each of that player's opponents may draw a card.

editions.flavor: His roots reach deep, nurtured not by soil and rain, but by millennia of experience.

name: Heartwood Storyteller Avatar
text:
The first creature spell you cast each turn costs {1} less to cast.
The first noncreature spell each opponent casts each turn costs {1} more to cast.

editions.flavor: FUT Prize Avatar

name: Heartwood Treefolk
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor:
"In all my years in Llanowar I never understood where trees fit in. They are revered by elves and watered on by dogs."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Heat of Battle
text: Whenever a creature blocks, Heat of Battle deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.

editions.flavor: "Takara, it's me!" shouted Starke. It was no use—she obeyed Volrath.

name: Heat Ray
text: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.

editions.flavor:
"There was clearly a scream. I'm not sure if there was a mouth."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House
It's not known whether the Thran built the device to forge their wonders or to defend them.

"There was clearly a scream. I'm not sure if there was a mouth."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House
It's not known whether the Thran built the device to forge their wonders or to defend them.

name: Heat Shimmer
text: Create a token that's a copy of target creature. That token has haste and "At the beginning of the end step, exile this permanent."

editions.flavor:
"Better to flare out than to gutter."
—Flamekin expression

name: Heat Stroke
text: At end of combat, destroy each creature that blocked or was blocked this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Stroke of heat or stroke of blade. Choose your fate, traitor."
—Maraxus of Keld, to Starke

name: Heat Wave
text:
Cumulative upkeep {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Blue creatures can't block creatures you control.
Nonblue creatures can't block creatures you control unless their controller pays 1 life for each blocking creature he or she controls.

name: Heaven's Gate
text: Any number of target creatures become white until end of turn.

name: Heavy Arbalest
Heavy Ballista
text: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor:
"Archers, ballistae—you can't even get near the island of Avenant."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

"Archers, ballistae—you can't even get near the island of Avenant."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

"Soldiers wear down and enemies collapse—but the ballista never tires."
—Ballista captain

name: Heavy Fog
text:
Cast Heavy Fog only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.

name: Heavy Infantry
text: When Heavy Infantry enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls.

editions.flavor: Doors, walls, skulls . . . it matters not. All barriers will be broken.
